intro: Cryptanthus santateresinhensis, commonly known as the Brazilian carnation or the pink star, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
